definition:
In mathematics, numbers often have to be written using roots or
fractional exponents. For example, the number $\sqrt{2}$ cannot be
written without using a root or writing $2^{1/2}$. A *surd* is an
irrational number which can be written as the sum of rational powers of
rational numbers. Another example would be $3\sqrt{2}-\sqrt[3]{5}$.
